title: Jamf Protect
descriptionMarkdown: The [Jamf Protect](https://www.jamf.com/products/jamf-protect/) connector provides the capability to read raw event data from Jamf Protect in Microsoft Sentinel.

sampleQueries.query:
jamfprotect_CL
 | where notempty(input_host_hostname_s) | summarize Event = count() by input_host_hostname_s
 | project-rename HostName = input_host_hostname_s
 | sort by Event desc

sampleQueries.description: Jamf Protect - Top 10 endpoints with Alerts
sampleQueries.query:
jamfprotect_CL
 | where topicType_s == 'alert' and notempty(input_eventType_s) and notempty(input_host_hostname_s)
 | summarize Event = count() by input_host_hostname_s
 | project-rename HostName = input_host_hostname_s
 | top 10 by Event

dataTypes.name: jamfprotect_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
jamfprotect_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
jamfprotect_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description: This connector reads data from the jamfprotect_CL table created by Jamf Protect in a Microsoft Analytics Workspace, if the [data forwarding](https://docs.jamf.com/jamf-protect/documentation/Data_Forwarding_to_a_Third_Party_Storage_Solution.html?hl=sentinel#task-4227) option is enabled in Jamf Protect then raw event data is sent to the Microsoft Sentinel Ingestion API.
